definition: to compete/competition/match/to surpass/better than/superior to/to excel

sentences.english: Project and runs which by the count-down result heel-to-toe walking race, calls " Track athletics " .
sentences.chinese: 以時間計算成績的競走和跑的項目，叫“徑賽”。

sentences.english: I've got to order a new track suit. Would you like me to come in with you?
sentences.chinese: 我得去定製一套新的徑賽服你想讓我陪你進去嗎？

sentences.english: Liu said the bidding should be as fair as the track and field events themselves.
sentences.chinese: 劉淇說，申辦活動應該像田賽和徑賽本身一樣公平。

sentences.english: So she signed up for four different track events.
sentences.chinese: 就這樣，她一口氣報了四個徑賽項目。

sentences.english: Track and field events have long been considered the center stage of the Olympic Games.
sentences.chinese: 一直以來，田徑賽始終被視爲是奧運比賽的核心舞臺。

sentences.english: The bidding should be as fair as the track and field events themselves.
sentences.chinese: 申辦活動應當像田賽和徑賽本身一樣公平。

sentences.english: Still, the bronze was China's first medal in track and field.
sentences.chinese: 至此爲止，這是中國在田徑賽場上的第一塊獎牌。

sentences.english: The field will be marked off for the track and field events which will take place tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 這場地將劃線標示，爲明天舉行的田徑賽作準備。

sentences.english: The annual athletic competition is round the corner again.
sentences.chinese: 一年一度的田徑賽又將來臨了。

sentences.english: The track star outran all of his competitors.
sentences.chinese: 那位徑賽明星比他所有的競爭對手跑得都快。

sentences.english: His eyes filled with pride and confidence, he ran in the filed.
sentences.chinese: 他在田徑賽場上跑着，眼睛裏閃着驕傲與自信。

sentences.english: Would I be finished with my physical therapy in time to run track?
sentences.chinese: 他問我療養結束時，是否還來得及參加田徑賽？

sentences.english: John: I'm not sure. I got track after school.
sentences.chinese: 我不確定，我下課後要參加田徑賽。

sentences.english: The short-term training prior to track and field events is the training method adopted by the common universities.
sentences.chinese: 田徑賽前短期訓練是普通高校經常採用的訓練方法。
